âœ¨ mobile-tester-agent | Kotlin
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Automating the testing of Android applications using AI-driven agents that can interpret and execute tests described in natural language.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Automated Android app testing using AI â€¢ Natural language test scenario interpretation with LLMs â€¢ Test execution on Android Emulator or Physical Device via ADB â€¢ Report generation for developers and QA teams â€¢ Web dashboard for configuration and visualization
ðŸ“– Summary: The Mobile Tester Agent is an AI-powered test automation tool for Android applications. It leverages LLMs to interpret natural language test scenarios and execute them on Android emulators or physical devices via ADB, generating reports and providing a web dashboard for configuration and visualization.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ cronboard | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Managing and scheduling cron jobs on local and remote servers through a terminal interface.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Check cron jobs â€¢ Autocompletion for paths when creating or editing cron jobs â€¢ Create cron jobs with validation and human-readable feedback â€¢ Pause and resume cron jobs â€¢ Edit existing cron jobs
ðŸ“– Summary: Cronboard is a terminal-based dashboard for managing cron jobs on local and remote servers. It allows users to easily add, edit, delete, pause, and resume cron jobs, as well as view their status and run times. The application connects to servers using SSH and provides autocompletion and validation features for creating and editing cron jobs.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ Open-Source-Face-Recognition-SDK | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Integrating face recognition capabilities into applications while ensuring data privacy through on-premise processing.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ 100% On-Premise processing â€¢ High Accuracy face detection and recognition â€¢ Real-Time Processing â€¢ Easy Integration with Python APIs â€¢ Cross-Platform compatibility (Windows and Linux)
ðŸ“– Summary: The Open Source Face Recognition SDK is a Python-based SDK for Windows and Linux that provides face detection, landmark extraction, feature extraction, and face template matching. It emphasizes on-premise processing for data privacy and offers high accuracy through deep learning models.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ tilf | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Creating pixel art sprites, icons, and small 2D assets.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Drawing tools (Pencil, Eraser, Fill, Eyedropper, Rectangle, Ellipse) â€¢ Canvas with zoom, editable background color, and optional grid â€¢ Undo/Redo with history â€¢ Drag & drop image opening â€¢ Real-time preview
ðŸ“– Summary: Tilf is a free and open-source pixel art editor built with PySide6, designed for creating sprites, icons, and small 2D assets. It offers essential drawing tools, live preview, undo/redo functionality, and various export options, aiming for a lightweight and dependency-free experience across Windows, MacOS, and GNU/Linux.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ docker-android | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Android application development and testing within Docker containers.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Emulator with different device profiles and skins â€¢ VNC support for accessing the container's GUI â€¢ Log sharing via web UI â€¢ ADB connect for external emulator control â€¢ Integration with Genymotion Cloud
ðŸ“– Summary: The docker-android repository provides Docker images for running Android emulators, enabling application development and testing in isolated environments. It supports various Android versions and device profiles, offers VNC access for visual interaction, and integrates with cloud solutions like Genymotion Cloud.
